business.headline: Amazon to target 30,000 corporate workers in largest ever job cuts: ReportAmazon will lay off up to 30,000 corporate employees starting Tuesday, its biggest round of cuts since 2022, as the tech giant trims costs and corrects pandemic-era overhiring across divisions.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as trade optimism boosts market sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed 566.96 points to close at 84,778.84, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 170.90 points to settle at 25,966.05. Broader markets also participated in the rally, even as volatility edged up ahead of the monthly F&O expiry.

How credit cards fuelled India's Diwali shopping partyA new survey has revealed how Indians turned to credit cards for high-value festive buys this Diwali, planning purchases smartly around cashback offers, no-cost EMIs and online deals.

Gold, silver prices are falling. Should you buy now or wait?Gold and silver prices are slipping as global optimism rises and profit-taking kicks in. Experts explain what's driving the fall and whether buyers should wait before investing.

Hospital bills are rising. Here's how to make your health insurance smarterAs medical inflation pushes treatment and hospital costs higher, insurers are reworking pricing and policies. Here's how flexible plans, wellness incentives, and smart choices can help you keep your cover affordable.

Supreme Court allows Centre to reconsider Vodafone Idea's plea on extra AGR duesFor Vodafone Idea, which is already burdened with mounting liabilities and ongoing financial strain, the top court's nod gives the Centre scope to reassess the dues, potentially opening a narrow path for relief or renegotiation.

Why modern parents are building 'Gold Vaults' instead of buying jewelleryParents are rethinking how they gift gold, moving beyond jewellery to create long-term "Gold Vaults" for their children. Here's how this modern plan turns tradition into a smart, inflation-proof investment.

Sensex jumps 600 points: Why is the stock market rising today?At 10:33 am, the NSE Nifty50 surged 171.25 points to 25,966.40, while the BSE Sensex jumped 575.03 points to 84,786.91. Broader market indices also traded higher, mirroring the upbeat sentiment on Dalal Street.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall: What's making precious metals lose their shine?Gold and silver prices are slipping after a strong two-month rally. Here's why the dollar's strength, easing tensions, and Fed expectations are cooling off investor appetite for bullion.

Sensex, Nifty rise as US trade deal hopes lift market moodAt 9:30 am, the BSE Sensex surged 306.28 points to 84,518.16, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 97.55 points to 25,892.70. Most broader market indices also traded higher in early deals, even as market volatility showed a mild uptick.

Luxury vs affordable housing: What homebuyers prefer during festive seasonThe festive months are traditionally seen as an auspicious time to buy homes. But as real estate sentiment rises across cities, one question stands out — are buyers chasing luxury spaces or choosing affordability amid rising costs?

LIC refutes Washington Post report on $3.9-billion Adani investment planA Washington Post report claimed that the Finance Ministry expedited a proposal directing nearly $3.9 billion (Rs 33,000 crore) in investments from the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) into the Adani Group. The life insurance major rejected the claims as baseless.
Writing a will? These common mistakes can land it in courtFrom Bollywood families to neighbourhood households, inheritance battles have shown that even the most watertight wills can spring leaks.

Reliance says it will comply with new US, Western sanctions on Russian oilThe oil-to-retail behemoth said that it is assessing the implications of restrictions announced by the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States on crude oil imports from Russia and the export of refined products to Europe.

No trade deals with a gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on India-US trade talksThis special report covers Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's firm message on India's approach to international trade negotiations, particularly regarding the United States. Speaking at the Berlin Global Dialogue, Mr. Goyal made it clear that India will not be rushed into agreements. He stated, 'we do not do deals in a hurry, and we do not go ahead and sign any deals with deadlines or with a gun to our head'. The minister emphasized that for India, trade deals are not merely about tariffs or market access but are long-term partnerships built on trust and mutual respect between nations. This stance comes amid ongoing trade discussions with both the US and the European Union, where India is advocating for fair and equitable agreements that benefit its businesses and economy in the long run.

Don't do deals with gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on trade talks with USIndia is exploring newer markets to reduce the impact of high tariffs and ensure fair trade terms for its exporters, said Piyush Goyal. He noted that India's approach is guided by strategy and self-interest rather than external pressure.
Sensex closes 320 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; HUL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 344.52 points to close at 84,211.88, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.25 points to end at 25,795.15.

Have you been investing in mutual funds the wrong way all this time?Experts say that most investors rely only on absolute returns while judging a mutual fund's performance. They focus on the number showing how much profit they've made, without understanding the factors behind those returns.

US maize import talks rattle Indian farmers as prices fall below MSPReports suggest that if the trade deal goes through and American maize starts entering Indian markets — prices could crash, and farmers may face huge losses.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: Why the stock market is falling todayThe fall came as investors engaged in profit booking following recent gains. After sustained upward movements, it is common for markets to experience short-term corrections as participants secure returns.

entertainment.headline: Mass Jathara trailer: Ravi Teja turns on action mode in commercial entertainer The trailer of Ravi Teja's latest film, 'Mass Jathara', has been released, drawing strong reactions from fans and building anticipation for its upcoming premiere and theatrical release.

Vijay Sethupathi's weak hand: Why Bigg Boss Tamil 9 is drowning in noise, violence Bigg Boss Tamil 9 marks the second consecutive year of Vijay Sethupathi hosting the reality show. However, his inability to reprimand the contestants, who indulge in violent behaviour, is a huge crack in the wall of a crumbling show.

Jungkook lifts Cha Eun Woo bridal style at First Ride premiere, BTS reunites BTS member Jungkook made an unexpected appearance at the VIP premiere of the South Korean film 'The First Ride', offering support to his friend Cha Eun Woo and drawing attention from fans and fellow celebrities.

David Harbour's cheating joke resurfaces after Lily Allen's open marriage hint David Harbour's 2023 joke referencing "cheating" has resurfaced following Lily Allen's new album discussing their open marriage. The couple, whose relationship began in 2019, divorced in December 2024.

John Dickerson exits CBS News after 16 years amid industry shifts John Dickerson, co-anchor of CBS Evening News, has announced his departure from CBS News at the end of the year, marking the end of his sixteen-year career at the network. The announcement follows significant developments within CBS and its parent company Paramount.

George Clooney joins Call My Agent The Movie, filming begins in Paris Hollywood star George Clooney confirms participation in Netflix's film adaptation of the popular French series as filming gets underway in Paris, with the original cast and creative team returning.

Neil Diamond joins Kate Hudson, Hugh Jackman via FaceTime at AFI Fest Neil Diamond makes a virtual appearance as Kate Hudson, Hugh Jackman and the cast of 'Song Sung Blue' present the film at the AFI Fest closing night in Hollywood, celebrating the legacy of his music and the story of a tribute band.

BB19 Episode 65: Housemates face nomination as Abhishek, Ashnoor break rule In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19', the entire house except Abhishek Bajaj and Ashnoor Kaur nominated as the two contestants, violated one importrant rule oif the show.

HAQ trailer: Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi reignite faith vs justice debate The makers of Emraan Hashmi and Yami Gautam-starrer released the trailer of 'HAQ'. The film is described as a love story, and seemingly a private dispute between a husband and wife shifts to a rousing debate on a provocative topic that begs a solution even today.

Emraan Hashmi reacts to his viral Ba***ds scene: Never imagined it would blow up Emraan Hashmi addressed the widespread attention surrounding his cameo in Aryan Khan's directorial debut, explores changing fan perceptions, and shares his thoughts as he promotes his upcoming film 'HAQ'.
Jamtara 2 actor Sachin Ganesh Chandwade dies by suicide 'Jamtara 2' actor Sachin Ganesh Chandwade died by suicide on Bhai Dooj. The actor was found dead in his Pune residence.

Ahaan Pandey's Saiyaara completes 100 days, mother Deanne shares gratitude post Actor Ahaan Pandey's mother Deanne Pandey shared an emotional post as 'Saiyaara' completed 100 days in theatres. She expressed heartfelt gratitude towards fans for their love and support on her son's debut film.

Actor through elder brother had director replace me in Tezaab: Aditya Pancholi Actor Aditya Pancholi says he was replaced in 'Tezaab' due to industry power play. He claims there are deeper issues of favouritism and manipulation beyond nepotism in Bollywood.

Samantha begins Maa Inti Bangaram shooting, Raj Nidimoru gives first clap Samantha began shooting for her upcoming film 'Maa Inti Bangaram'. The actor kick-started the shoot with a mahurat ceremony where Raj Nidimoru gave the first clap.

Dharmendra told underworld he had truck-loads in Punjab to fight with him: Report Actor-director Satyajeet Puri shared how Dharmendra fearlessly warned the underworld. This rare anecdote reveals the veteran's legendary courage and influence beyond films.

Ajay Devgn admits he used to be heavy drinker, now prefers Rs 60,000 premium malt Ajay Devgn opened up about his transformation from being a heavy drinker to adopting a more moderate approach, sharing personal experiences and reflections on the factors that influenced his choices.

OTT this week: Baaghi 4, Kantara: Chapter 1 to Idli Kadai; When and where to watch This week promises an exciting lineup of new films and shows on OTT. So sit back, relax, grab your popcorn, and get ready to pick your next favourite watch.

Ram Nath Kovind becomes 1st Indian President to feature in devotional film For the first time in India's history, a former President and his family participated in a devotional film, reciting the Namokar Mantra, marking a significant cultural moment.

Rajamouli, Prabhas, Rana reunite as they discuss favourite scenes from Baahubali In anticipation of the theatrical release of 'Baahubali: The Epic', director SS Rajamouli gathers for a conversation with lead actors Prabhas and Rana Daggubati. They revisit their experiences and the most memorable moments from the landmark franchise, sharing insights and personal highlights with audiences.

general news.headline: Cyclone Montha to make landfall today, heavy rain batters coastal Andhra, OdishaCyclone Montha is intensifying over the Bay of Bengal, threatening Andhra Pradesh and Odisha with severe winds and heavy rain. The states are rushing evacuations ahead of the landfall expected later this evening.

Horror! Delhi acid attack was staged by the woman and her father to extract revengeThe father of the 20-year-old Delhi University student, who was attacked with acid, confessed to plotting the attack to frame the main accused. He was arrested in a rape case filed by the accused's wife, who alleged that he sent her obscene photos to her husband.

Making big mistake with India: Ex-US Commerce Secretary slams Trump's trade policyFormer US Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo criticised Trump's America Alone policy, warning it isolates allies and risks damaging ties with India amid escalating US-India trade tensions and tariff disputes.

Amazon to target 30,000 corporate workers in largest ever job cuts: ReportAmazon will lay off up to 30,000 corporate employees starting Tuesday, its biggest round of cuts since 2022, as the tech giant trims costs and corrects pandemic-era overhiring across divisions.

Emotional vs physical cheating: Which hurts more? Relationship experts answerWe took the 'emotional cheating vs physical cheating' question to relationship experts. And it turns out, one of them might just be the bigger troublemaker.

Live: Flights, trains cancelled; high waves along Andhra coast, red alert in OdishaCyclone Montha Live Updates: As Cyclone Montha is expected to make landfall today, Andhra Pradesh and Odisha were placed on high alert, triggering precautionary evacuations and post-landfall preparations. Weather authorities have warned of rough sea conditions along the Andhra coast from Nellore to Srikakulam, with waves likely to rise between 2 and 4.7 metres as the system intensifies into a cyclonic storm on Tuesday morning. Most parts of coastal Andhra Pradesh is forecast to receive light to moderate rainfall, with heavy to very heavy showers in some areas and extremely heavy rainfall at isolated locations between October 27 and 29. Stay with indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

US announces new entry, exit regulations for foreigners, Green Card holdersThe US will require all non-citizens, including Green Card holders, to undergo facial recognition and biometric checks at all entry and exit points from December 26, 2025. The system aims to curb visa overstays and identity fraud. Experts, however, warn it may disproportionately affect minorities and raise privacy concerns, calling it a step toward pervasive surveillance.

Hello, Teddy Boy: Assam BJP mocks Priyank Kharge's jab at Himanta SarmaThe feud between Himanta Biswa Sarma and Priyank Kharge erupted after the Karnataka Minister allegedly told a news channel that semiconductor investments meant for his state were being diverted towards Gujarat and Assam, after being "arm-twisted" by the Centre.

Covering up for brother? Heckler confronts King Charles over Andrew-Epstein tiesAndrew, 65, has been under scrutiny for years over his behaviour and friendship with Epstein. He earlier this month said that he would give up all his royal titles, including using his title of Duke of York, saying accusations against him distract the monarchy.

Too cute: Trump rejects VP talk, keeps third-term speculation alive for 2028President Donald Trump ruled out running for vice president in 2028, calling it "too cute," but declined to rule out seeking a third term, fuelling speculation about extending his presidency.

Bangladesh Islamists demand a ban on ISKCON, call it extremist Hindutva outfitThousands of Islamists took to the streets across Bangladesh, demanding an immediate ban on ISKCON, which they labelled as an "extremist organisation", based on the Jewish model. The coordinated rallies in Dhaka and Chattogram after Friday prayers mark a sharp escalation in anti-Hindu rhetoric and reveal the clout of fundamentalist groups in Muhammad Yunus's interim set-up.

AI minister pregnant with 83 children: Albania PM's bizarre revelationAlbania's PM Edi Rama announced that the country's AI anti-corruption minister, Diella, is "pregnant" with 83 AI assistants to aid Socialist MPs, symbolising Albania's bold digital governance revolution.

Shreyas Iyer's spleen injury decoded: The risks, recovery and what comes nextShreyas Iyer's spleen injury, sustained during the Sydney ODI, has raised concern among fans. Here's what a splenic laceration means, how it's treated, and what his road to recovery could look like as doctors monitor his progress closely in Sydney.

They misunderstood: In court, Kangana Ranaut regrets 2020 farmers' protest tweetKangana Ranaut in 2020 had posted on X, misidentifying Mahinder Kaur as Bilkis Dadi, one of the faces of the anti-CAA protests at Shaheen Bagh, and alleged that the woman was "available for Rs 100" to attend demonstrations.

Did Yunus gift map to Pak general showing India's Northeast in Bangladesh?Experts believe that the artwork presented by Yunus to a Pakistani general shows a controversial map depicting Assam and other northeastern states as part of Bangladesh.

Uddhav Thackeray calls Amit Shah Anaconda, accuses BJP of trying to swallow MumbaiShiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray fiercely criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah, accusing BJP of trying to dominate Mumbai through unfair means. He also warned the Election Commission against voter fraud and called for a fair electoral contest.

Who was Rani Abbakka? The 16th-century queen who led India's first naval warQueen Abbakka of Ullal led a formidable naval defence against Portuguese colonial forces in the 16th century. Her strategic alliances and guerrilla tactics made her a legendary symbol of resistance in coastal Karnataka.

Pakistan PM earns gold in Olympic sport for flattering Trump, says ex-envoyReacting to Shebaz Sharif's latest gush of admiration for Donald Trump, ex-envoy Husain Haqqani took to X with a tongue-in-cheek post that quickly caught attention.

Delhi likely to witness artificial rain today if weather permitsThe cloud seeding trial, aimed at inducing artificial rain to tackle air pollution in Delhi, is part of the government's broader strategy to mitigate deteriorating air quality during the winter months.

Corporate burnout now a public health crisis?India's corporate sector faces a silent epidemic of burnout and addiction. The rising mental health crisis demands urgent cultural shifts and systemic reforms in workplaces.

Vijay Sethupathi's weak hand: Why Bigg Boss Tamil 9 is drowning in noise, violenceBigg Boss Tamil 9 marks the second consecutive year of Vijay Sethupathi hosting the reality show. However, his inability to reprimand the contestants, who indulge in violent behaviour, is a huge crack in the wall of a crumbling show.

Now 'vote chori' game in 12 states: Opposition's attack on poll body over SIRThe Congress has criticised the Election Commission's decision to expand the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls to 12 states, alleging that the move was politically motivated and premature while related matters remain before the Supreme Court.

Notorious Lawrence Bishnoi aide Jagdeep alias Jagga arrested near US-Canada borderGangster Jagdeep Singh alias Jagga, aide of Lawrence Bishnoi, was arrested near the US-Canada border after a global manhunt. Rajasthan Police confirmed extradition efforts are underway to bring him to India.

World's oldest president, Paul Biya, wins Cameroon election at 92Cameroon's Constitutional Council declared 92-year-old Paul Biya winner with 53.66% of the vote. Protests over the Oct. 12 election turned deadly, leaving at least four dead amid claims of irregularities.

sports.headline: Harshit Rana wins over critics, shows Gambhir's backing paid off Harshit Rana silenced critics with a four-wicket spell in Sydney, turning doubters like Kris Srikkanth into admirers. Backed by Gautam Gambhir, the 23-year-old pacer proved he belongs, blending aggression with control to mark his arrival on the big stage.

Lamine Yamal's El Clasico lesson: Talk is cheap, and football is beyond one season Lamine Yamal went from being Europe's breakout star in Spain's Euro 2024 and Barcelona's treble triumph to becoming a headline magnet for all the wrong reasons. The 18-year-old's personal controversies now threaten to overshadow his brilliance.

Free from Ro-Ko shadow, can Shubman Gill stake his claim in T20I side? Free from the Ro-Ko shadow, Shubman Gill will now have the task of getting his spot fixed in the T20I side for India. With some key lessons from the Asia Cup and the pressure from competition, can Gill nail down his place?

BAN vs WI: Hope, Powell and bowlers star as West Indies win 1st T20I by 16 runs West Indies started their T20I series against Bangladesh with a convincing 16-run win on Monday, October 27. Shai Hope and Rovman Powell starred with the bat while the bowlers put the squeeze on the hosts to secure the victory.

Shreyas Iyer's spleen injury decoded: The risks, recovery and what comes next Shreyas Iyer's spleen injury, sustained during the Sydney ODI, has raised concern among fans. Here's what a splenic laceration means, how it's treated, and what his road to recovery could look like as doctors monitor his progress closely in Sydney.

Juventus sack Igor Tudor after winless run, appoint Brambilla as interim coach Juventus have dismissed head coach Igor Tudor following a series of poor results. The club hopes interim coach Massimo Brambilla can reverse the team's fortunes amid growing pressure.

BCCI VP Rajeev Shukla wishes Shreyas Iyer a speedy recovery after spleen injury BCCI Vice-President Rajeev Shukla wished Shreyas Iyer a speedy recovery after the batter suffered a laceration to his spleen while taking a stunning catch in the third ODI against Australia. The BCCI confirmed he is medically stable and recovering in Sydney.

Josh Hazlewood sends Ashes warning to England: Wouldn't sledge any of our batters Josh Hazlewood has sent a warning to England ahead of the Ashes series, telling them that they shouldn't look to sledge the Australian players. The Ashes last time around saw the controversial Jonny Bairstow stumping incident at Lord's, which led to tensions between both teams.

D Gukesh returns to Goa as World Champion to lead India at FIDE World Cup 2025 World Champion D Gukesh is set to lead India at the FIDE World Cup 2025 in Goa, a place close to his heart from his early chess days, marking a special homecoming for the prodigy.

Women's World Cup: Shafali Verma replaces injured Pratika Rawal before semifinal The Indian team has added Shafali Verma to the squad after she was approved as the replacement for Pratika Rawal on Monday, October 27.

Suryakumar's form not a concern, okay to fail when fearless: Gautam Gambhir India head coach Gautam Gambhir is not concerned about Suryakumar Yadav's poor run in international cricket. Gambhir said that it was okay to fail while playing fearless cricket.

BCCI VP Rajeev Shukla wishes Shreyas Iyer a speedy recovery after spleen injury BCCI Vice-President Rajeev Shukla wished Shreyas Iyer a speedy recovery after the batter suffered a laceration to his spleen while taking a stunning catch in the third ODI against Australia. The BCCI confirmed he is medically stable and recovering in Sydney.

The Ashes last time around saw the controversial Jonny Bairstow stumping incident at Lord's, which led to tensions between both teams.

Women's World Cup: Shafali Verma replaces injured Pratika Rawal before semifinal The Indian team has added Shafali Verma to the squad after she was approved as the replacement for Pratika Rawal on Monday, October 27.

Suryakumar's form not a concern, okay to fail when fearless: Gautam Gambhir India head coach Gautam Gambhir is not concerned about Suryakumar Yadav's poor run in international cricket. Gambhir said that it was okay to fail while playing fearless cricket.

Mourinho has the last laugh: Turkey moves to punish 371 referees in betting scandalTurkey's football federation has disciplined 371 referees for betting violations. This scandal highlights deep-rooted corruption and raises questions about football governance in Turkey.

Watch: Rohit Sharma returns to Mumbai in style to chorus of Hitman chantsRohit Sharma got a hero's welcome as he returned to Mumbai after his fine performance in the Australia series. Rohit scored a hundred and a fifty during the ODI series down under.

Usman Khawaja backs Marnus Labuschagne, tips Renshaw to make comebackUsman Khawaja backed Marnus Labuschagne to be part of the Australia team and tipped his Queensland opening partner Matt Renshaw to make a return the side for the Ashes. Australia are looking to find a partner for Khawaja at the top of the order.

Who replaces Pratika Rawal? Ex-cricketers weigh in ahead of Australia semisIndia's opening batter Pratika Rawal is ruled out of the Women's World Cup 2025 semi-final due to injury. The team faces a critical selection decision that could impact their chances against Australia.

Beating stigma: Kannagi Nagar's Karthika shines with Kabaddi goldHailing from Kannagi Nagar, Karthika has made the whole Tamil Nadu proud with her performance as the vice-captain of the U-18 women's kabaddi team during the youth Asian Games. India clinched gold in women's kabaddi with Karthika playing a big role in the win.

Vinicius's Clasico meltdown: Should Xabi be worried about his Real Madrid exit?Vinicius Jr's fiery El Clasico debut ended in drama as he reportedly threatened to leave after being subbed off. Xabi Alonso, however, remained unfazed, keeping his focus firmly on Real Madrid's win.

Rohit Sharma 3.0: Fitter at 38, ready to run marathons againIn Australia, Rohit Sharma showed that he was ready to grind it out to secure a place for the 2027 ODI World Cup. At 38, is Rohit once again ready to return to his old role of an accumulator?

Everyone is just trying to push Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli down: AB de VilliersAB de Villiers has slammed the critics of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli after the duo excelled for India during the final ODI against Australia. De Villiers said that people are constantly trying to pull down the Indian star duo.

Beating stigma: Kannagi Nagar's Karthika shines with Kabaddi goldHailing from Kannagi Nagar, Karthika has made the whole Tamil Nadu proud with her performance as the vice-captain of the U-18 women's kabaddi team during the youth Asian Games. India clinched gold in women's kabaddi with Karthika playing a big role in the win.

De Villiers said that people are constantly trying to pull down the Indian star duo.
AUS vs IND: Indian-origin spinner roped in to replace Adam Zampa in T20I seriesAustralia have named Tanveer Sangha as Adam Zampa's replacement for the upcoming T20I series against India.

Mitchell Marsh has a route back for Australia's Ashes squad: Andrew McDonaldAustralia coach Andrew McDonald has stated that the door is firmly open on Mitchell Marsh's return to the Test squad for the upcoming Ashes series. Marsh last played a Test match in 2024.

Australia players provided police escort in Mumbai after Indore incidentAustralian women cricketers were given police escorts in Navi Mumbai following harassment in Indore. The incident has led to tightened security measures to protect players during the World Cup.

How Xabi Alonso's gutsy tactics helped Real Madrid cut through Barcelona's fading edgeXabi Alonso's first El Clasico as Real Madrid manager was a tactical statement wrapped in nostalgia. Calm on the touchline and bold in his calls, he outwitted Barcelona to deliver Madrid's sweetest revenge yet.

PAK vs SA: Pakistan coach reveals Babar Azam's batting position on T20I returnBabar Azam is set to return to Pakistan's T20I team, batting at number three against South Africa. This move aims to strengthen Pakistan's top order ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Ankle injury ends Pratika Rawal's World Cup journey before Australia semifinal: ReportIndia's World Cup campaign has reportedly hit a hurdle, with opener Pratika Rawal likely to miss the semi-final against Australia. The in-form batter twisted her ankle during the final league match against Bangladesh.
IND vs SA: Temba Bavuma is back, South Africa name 15-man squad for India TestsSouth Africa have named their squad for the upcoming Test series against India with Temba Bavuma returning as captain.

PV Sindhu ends 2025 season early after failing to recover from foot injuryTwo-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu, 30, confirmed on Monday that she was ending her season early. Sindhu, who reached the quarterfinal of the World Championships in August, has been recovering from a foot injury.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
